Extra Notes: -Accepts credit card -Sign up for their birthday list online and receive a free burger on your birthday! -Decor is tacky, but in an amusing, care-free way -Bottomless fries! Make sure to get those delicious onion rings too! -Friendly service -Parking is never a problem -Clean restrooms

My son loved his pizza. My burger was ok. The beer on tap was flat and not very cold. We were seated quickly and the greeter was friendly. Our waiter at was slow and not very aware of our needs. Had to ask for napkins, field and refills. We won't be coming back any time soon.

Love the BBQ chicken wrap and the strawberry lemonade. Service was great but the restaurant was packed so we chose to eat in the bar so we didn't have to wait, and it was like Arctic freezing. Everyone was complaining and the server said they could not turn down the air. Food and service were great walked out of there with frostbite. Ha ha

My family and I eat out practically every meal. We've become accustomed to certain restaurants as well as some specific waiters/waitresses at each. One of the places we frequent is Red Robin. We love this particular location and many of the servers there. The burgers are fabulous as are the soups and salads. We have, had an off night on occasion but most of the time our expectations are exceeded. One of my favorite burgers is the Banzai. It's deliciously prepared with cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato and grilled pineapple smothered in teriyaki sauce. Of course, they have a chicken version of this as well, for those who don't like red meat, and it is equally as delicious. The tower of onion rings is a great appetizer. For those of you looking for something a little lighter, I've had all of the soups and salads and cannot complain about any of them. The Chicken Tortilla Soup as well as the Clam Chowder are both fabulous. As for the salads, my top three would be the Southwest Chicken, the Avo-cobb-o, and my favorite the Apple Harvest. My 5 year old son loves the kids meals, especially the Mac It Yours (Mac N Cheese) and the Chicken Stickens and my wife's favorite meal is the Clucks and Fries (Buzz style).  Most importantly though are the servers. Always pleasant and helpful. Tara, Brayden, John, and Jasmine are our favorite servers. They are always cheerful and try to take care of us to the best of their abilities. I would definitely recommend Red Robin, Cypress to anyone looking for a good burger, and great atmosphere in a family oriented setting.

Positive: - Salad and burger tasted good. - Menu lists calories next to each item (or is that required by law?) - Free unlimited fries Negative:  - Tablet on the table is annoying, especially the bombardment of adverts. I felt sad watching kids zone out playing crappy Red Robin sponsored games.  - The quality of food is reminiscent of fast food, same old mass-produced frozen food reheated to serve the masses.  - Server was annoyingly happy and bouncy and replied "absolutely" to everything, including comments we made where the word "absolutely" makes no sense (reminds me of the waiter in the movie The Office). He also came to our table every 5 minutes and wouldn't give us time to eat our food - I had to reply that everything was okay with a mouth full of food.  - Free Unlimited Fries taste horrible (and we never got a refill, which was actually a good thing)

Poor wait staff with UNSANITARY bathroom habits.  Caution to those who eat and drink at the bar.  Came here with my family I think three Sunday's ago and my mom was in the bathroom and saw that the bartender (big tall white girl with purple hair) threw her apron on the bathroom floor of the stall while she was using the toilet.  Gross. Luckily we were sitting in the dining area but it was very unappetizing to think about and makes you wonder about the health practices here. I used to love Red Robin.  In fact it was my favorite restaurant when I was a kid.  I would always pick it for my birthday dinners.  For a time this corporate franchise was holding it down amongst the huge influx of trendy restaurants.  Im not frou frou, give me a solid burger and those endless steak fries with a side of ranch and I'm golden.  Not sure if it is just this location or if the quality and size of the burgers have gone down everywhere, but my once loved favorite Whiskey BBQ Burger has certainly diminished.   I came to this location once before and the wait staff was terrible but since I love Red Robin so much and this one is so close to my house I decided to give it another shot.  The second time was just as disappointing.  Our server was okay, not very attentive, and fake friendly.  We waited over 25min for our food, not good but not awful I guess.  The restaurant was not at all busy (surprise surprise).  I used to get some of the best service ever at Red Robin (obviously not this location).  I even remember telling a waiter that he was the best server I ever had!  What happen to those people?? Baby come back! Guess those days are over.  You can't say I didn't give it a second chance!  Red Robin, after a 20+ year love affair, I think we should see other people.  We had a good run.  It's you though. It's definitely you.

I've been here twice recently and I will say the first time things went by okay...it wasn't that busy but still it felt like they were under staffed and our waitress looked like she was spread out all over the place. The 2nd time was just terrible. We waited an hour for our food and the waiter kept saying your food is on its way...finally I had enough of the B.S when I realized the people that came after is were getting their food before us! So I asked to speak to the manager and he apologized and explained that our ticket got lost in the kitchen and their was a huge misunderstanding. Needless to say I appreciated his honesty and the fact that he offered to handle the bill for us.

This place made me stop going to red Robin.  It's a true shame because the other locations are decent.   The chefs here serve cold burgers.  Even I as a horrible cook,  know that, you take the buns off last.  That way,  the bread is hot when it is served to a guest.  The buns came out frigid cold.  I sent it back.  The burgers set you back at least $10. They should have the very basics down.   The server brings it back after a wait. And guess what?  It's still frickin cold.   Are you purposely insulting me chef?  Rather than complain, and allow the business to correct their mistake.  I took the insult as an insult, and swore off this chain.  You guys have lost me forever.  It is done.

Wow the service at this place has really gone down. It took for ever to get our drink and our food. We are still here waiting for more fries. But I'm ready to walk out. The food is good but service needs to improve. Not coming back for a while.
Good food and service! Great menu selection. Need to try the desserts on my next visit.

The SKY HIGH BURGER was ****ing AMAZING! Definitely served to perfection. I was a bit skeptical about the goat cheese but once i tasted the fusion of the siracha type sauce mixed with the onion rings, bacon, and the overall juiciness of the patty, it just became heaven in my mouth. MUST TRY!

We came here for lunch on a week day around 11:30 and the place had just started to get busy for lunch. This restaurant is in a shopping center with Costco so there is a lot of parking. We also came here with a two year old and they were very accommodating to her and provided a high chair. We even ordered a juice, but requested mostly water to be put in it and the waiter didn't charge us for it, as he understood that a two year old wouldn't be drinking much of it. The prices overall are pretty reasonable for good burgers. We ordered a Bleu Ribbon Burger and a Royal Red Robin Burger. The Bleu Ribbon Burger is a classic blue cheese burger. Lately when I've ordered these burgers the blue cheese is mild, but this one was a little more than mild, which I enjoyed! The Royal Red Robin Burger had a fried egg and bacon on top and it was awesome! The steak french fries were also golden brown, crunchy, and hot.  When we were on our way out I was in a food coma because it was so good and I ate it all!  I will definitely be returning here!

I am never disappointed with the food at ANY Red Robin; but this one had something special there. Our server. My wife and I were craving burgers, so we stopped at the closest Red Robin we could find, on our way home. The wait was reasonably fast for being lunch hour. Shortly after sitting down, our server, FRANCIS, was on top of it. Within minutes we had drinks and a basket of hot fries to munch on, while our burgers were being made. Now my wife and I are big on customer service. Even though FRANCIS had other tables, she checked on us every few minutes, to make sure we we doing ok. It's because of FRANCIS' speed, courtesy, professionalism, and attention to detail, that we gave her a good tip. You EARNED it. Even though we live in the next county, we will drive to Red Robin-Cypress, just for FRANCIS' OUTSTANDING SERVICE.

I generally like Red Robins and most of their burgers taste pretty good. I have to say some of their wraps are pretty yummy, too. My favorite burger is banzai burger - their version of teriyaki/hawaiian burger. It's so moist, a little bit sweet - just a nice combination of all that goodness! That's what I enjoyed in my latest visit there! I am a fan of their steak fries, esp. when they come out really hot and crispy + sprinkle their seasoning! So yummy! I noticed that they now have garlic fries that you can substitute for $0.99 extra so I thought I'd give it a shot. It was actually a terrible idea! It was not good at all. They just sprinkle garlic powder over the regular fries, some pre-shredded Parmesan cheese, and sprinkle some parsley (I couldn't tell if they are dried parsley or fresh one :0) Nothing fancy and didn't really make it gourmet either. A little disappointed but that's ok, I'll just stick to what I like and what they do better - the regular steak fries.  BTW, if you join their burger club, you can get a free burger on your b-day month! Woohoo!

My birthday burgers never fail to arrive year after year. The quality of the burgers are consistently yummy as well as those endless garlic fries. This place beats slaters 50/50 any day in my opinion. Recently have a new found obsession with fried mushrooms and they have some of the best. Love being a royal member as I get discounts. As much as I would love to eat here all the time it probably would not be a good idea haha. They do have some healthier options and offer veggie, turkey and chicken options for your patty as well as salads and other types of sadwhiches. I can't say I loved this place when I first went but now it's a favorite but then again I never really went out to eat before.

One star for good taste of the food and the nice little server named Tori ( not even our server), or it would have been 0 stars. I have never felt so I unwelcome to a place in my life! I never write a bad review but this place deserves it.. I don't know if it was the color of our skin, or because we were overly dressed from visiting santa, or because we have 4 kids but we waited a fairly long time to get our food ( the place was not even 1/3 occupied) and what they call bottomless fries should be called wait till your done with all your food or till it's cold so you can feel awkward when you  do ask for more.. and wait best part when walking out you hear another serve asking there table if there kids wanted balloons while my kids just heard.. smh so sad.. I will never take my money to this location ever again.

Went last Saturday night around 5 OClock, wasn't busy at all. The hostess was nice & greeted us the moment we came in the door, we were then seated right away, the food was good, prices were decent, TVs had the game on.  All in all, it's a nice family spot.

Let me start by saying we are a total Red Robin fan favorite.  So I'm so sad to say that we were so disappointed when choosing the Cypress Red Robin for my Niece's softball win Saturday night to celebrate. Just a bad experience overall: 1st got there around 8pm not crowded at all and had to wait to be seated for a party of 10, that they clearly had enough servers and could have pushed after tables together or asked if we wanted to just sit near each other. 2nd when they did seat is it was outside (freezing) which we didn't say anything because they turned the heaters on (still cold)  but we just went with it 3rd a group of the servers saw us out there and all looked at us like ummmm ok who's gonna take that large party.  When someone finally did step up, she's was actually a sweet girl (best part of this post) 4th our food arrived and the fish and chips were overlooked very dry and chewy, the fish sandwich was the same way and the burgers were barely warm.  We usually have food left over to take home, we left everything there 5th so sad the took the Cerritos one away, that was our go to on a whim.  Will not be going back to Cypress ever

So, my wife and I go into the RR in cypress...we order a BBQ Chicken Burger and what we got would cause embarrassment to the Red Robin himself!  Imagine this....a chicken breast that someone took and pounded it out so thin that it was less than 1/4" thick, but the bun was too big to cover all of the chicken.  I'm sorry but Red Robin is going to hell in a hand basket.  I'll post a pic of it shortly.

Bad service in an empty restaurant for 5:30 pm dinner. Prices are 10.99-14.99 for subpar hamburgers and the reorder of fries took 20 min to arrive and they were cold. Server spent 10 minutes trying to sell us on joining their members program, appetizers and up selling us our food order. Wish she spent that same time attention getting us hot food in a timely manner. Too many better options in the neighborhood to come back.

This is our go to place to get a quick bite. Although inside the restaurant  is very clean, something needs to be said about there patio area. This is the first time my wife and I sat out here and it's not where you wan to eat. This area is very dirty. Tables and chairs are not clean. Webs are underneath the table and chairs. Cement floor looks like it hasn't been cleaned in a long while. This needs some attention.

My family ate here tonight. I ordered the cod burger with sweet potato fries. Inside my burger was a slice of hard core of cabbage and the cod fish is blunt, the fries is saggy:-( Server was not that good either, she was training one employee with her in training. Total..$85 is not worth to spend here.

I've been eating at Red robbin  for years, specifically the one in Cypress on katella. In the last say three years or more, the quality of the food and the service has gone down drastically!. Mostly the food, especially  when you're  there for a birthday party, and a child has to wait for their food. Waiting longer than the adults to get their dinner, then getting an under cooked burger that makes them sick the next day.!! Tonight I ordered take out, im not surprised to say the order was all wrong, half the food was cold , big disappointment!! Ruined my Oscar nite dinner!!!! This restaurant really needs to up the quality  of the food served and the people who serve it, that don't know their menu. Proper training would help tremendously!! Even though the manager comped my dinner ,I wouldn't  recommend this place to anyone, and will no longer be eating there.

The game console and payment system is pretty cool. We came to celebrate a family occasion and the restaurant was fairly crowded. Our server seemed new or extra busy, but gave it her best. My oldest ordered fish and chips which she didn't like and our server suggested the Tavern Double which she loved. The fries are always fresh and fantastic. I've always loved their French Onion soup and hubby orders the Whisky River BBQ burger every single time.

Okay, today I had another underwhelming visit here. I ordered a chicken dish with "Mexican spices" that came with a salad. Our server was pleasant but "cool," distant even. The food took a while but not what I would call a long time. When the food was brought to the table by a different team member (like many restaurants do these days) we started eating.  I could not cut the chicken breast with the dull butter knife they provided but no one ever came to check on how we were doing. I had asked for the Baja ranch dressing for the greens but they brought regular ranch. My bad for not catching that before the person left who had delivered our meals. Our server NEVER came back to see if our meal was good or if we needed anything...like a steak knife... Getting the check and change was also a bit...lame. My chicken was tough and getting our servers attention was almost impossible. Seems hit or miss unless A) You get a good server, and B) order a burger

I have been to this restaurant many times, always for a late lunch.  After a day of packing I decided to bring my friend/helper for fish and chips, my usual order.  This was around 3:30PM, well after the lunch rush and before the Friday dinner crowd.  The restaurant was not crowded by any stretch of the imagination. After being seated we waited a few minutes for the waiter - Riley - we ordered margaritas, and since we had been sitting for a while and already perused the menu, we were ready to order.  I ordered a kid's fish and chips (basically a half order) with a side of cole slaw, as did my friend, and a short stack of onion rings.  The drinks were brought by a server other than Riley, and then we got our onion rings, also by someone other than Riley. We waited about 30 minutes for our fish and chips and when it came out, again by a different server, we got the two pieces of fish and about two tablespoons of cole slaw (another story there - barely any dressing), no tarter sauce, no vinegar, no chips.  I explained to the gal that this wasn't what we had ordered she immediately got an attitude and actually said to us "Well don't look at me, it's not my fault."  Really?  I try to give females the benefit of the doubt, hormones and all, but she was just plain nasty.  She then disappeared to bring us a "side of fries."  15 minutes later we still hadn't received the fries, tartar sauce or vinegar, meanwhile the fish is sitting on our plates getting cooler and cooler.  Seriously?  This is a burger and fries place - how freakin' long should getting fries take?  Certainly not 15 minutes.   I finally flagged down Riley - who hadn't been back to our table - no new drinks, no "how's your meal" no nothing.  I again explained the situation and told him that while we were waiting for our fries, our fish was now lukewarm and we wanted a refry (fresh fish).  He also copped an attitude and took our plates back.  No, "Gosh, I'm sorry, let me fix that for you." And he STILL didn't ask if we'd like another drink.   And there goes another 20+ minutes out of my life I'll never get back....  I flag down the manager, explain the situation and he goes off to the kitchen.  A couple minutes later the manager brings out our food.  The only problem is they didn't replace the fish. And I know this because I had taken a bite off one of the fish pieces and got the same piece back, except this time one side was soggy and the fish was rubbery, which is what happens if something is microwaved or put under a heat lamp.  I'm waiting for Riley to come around, which he doesn't (I think he was avoiding us) until another party is seated next to us.  He doesn't even glance at us or ask if the food is OK, would you like another drink, zero, zip, nada coming out of the mouth of our "I'm Riley, I'll be taking care of you today."  Arrgggggg.   At this point I was beyond PO'd, my face is red and I look at my friend and she's steaming as well.  We got up, went to the front to settle up for the drinks and onion rings (I'm not going to run out on a bill for something I have imbibed or eaten) and are told to wait while they get the manager.  When the manager comes I tell him about the fish being the same pieces we had sent back, rubbery, not hot, soggy, etc.  I told him we were fed up with waiting, fed up with the servers' attitudes, fed up with having to wait and wait and wait, only to get the same lukewarm fish, fed up but not fed and we just wanted to settle our drink bill and get out.  He offered a couple of times to get us food to go which was very kind, but I wasn't about ready to wait another half hour.  He did give me a couple of cards good for appetizers, and insisted on taking care of our drinks.   I will be back because I love the RR fish and chips, and I'm hoping this was was just a bad day, but I absolutely will not sit in Riley's section and won't wait so long to leave if something like this happens again.  On a good note, the manager was great and I hope he chewed out a couple of people.   BTW, we ended up at California Fish Grill, which was great.

I don't generally write reviews and I have had decent experiences at this location in the past.  However, my experience this evening demands a review if for no other reason then to provide constructive commentary that may be used in an instructive manner.  I ordered a southern charm burger, iced tea and a side of poppy seed honey mustard dressing.  I also asked for no onions, no lettuce and to have the burger on a kaiser roll (I know, a high maintenance order albeit one that has not posed any issues in the past). My order arrived on the wrong type of bun.  When I pointed out to the server that the bun was not what I ordered, he annoyingly said " I don't know if we have the kaiser rolls since we discontinued the burger it came on"....what?  I have ordered my burger on the kaiser bun since Red Robin began offering them (it has literally been years) - including last week at this very location.  He ran back to the kitchen to check and a few minutes later came back and said they did have the rolls did I want him to change it out....isn't that why I pointed out the mistake in the first place.... I said yes.    My burger came back on the correct bun but had more mayonnaise then I have ever seen on a burger...it must have had at least 2 1/2 tablespoons plopped on the top.  When I asked the server if the burger looked correct to him because if is the burger I always order and it had excessive amounts of mayo.  He told me it has always come that way.  When I told him that I order it all the time and it has never had this much mayo, he argued with me and said I was wrong that it has ALWAYS been saved that way ALWAYS! I gave up at that point, paid the 17 for my meal that I did not even bite into and left.   I will not be going back to this location, it was truly an awful experience.

Great place to unwind and have a burger. The remodel of the restaurant looks great. Thanks to the guys in the bar they always take cary of us so we're able to enjoy a drink and our favorite burger. Thanks to the corporate office for taking care of us gluten free individuals so we are not left out.

The service was ridiculously fast. Went to catch up with an old friend and was expecting mediocre service between ordering/getting food so we'd have more time to talk. Especially on a Saturday night. We got our drinks/food super fast. And our refills just. As fast! I believe a lady manager/supervisor was walking around helping tables out. Our server was a guy named "Ellie."

I didn't hate the experience here. Nice staff and cool atmosphere. But I thought burgers are just burgers and price was really high. My son and I had 2 burgers, regular fries, and 2 drinks. Tap was almost $40. We should've gone to some place better if we were to spend $40.

Oh Red Robin, you have proven yourself to be a difficult adversary indeed. While this review is being written under this franchise location, I must stress that this is a blanket review, one that covers all Red Robins. Consider this an open letter, oh bird of burgers. I suppose I should start at the beginning, though I cannot for the life of me reckon where the beginning is. I have been a patron of Red Robin for many years; as far back as I can remember the gourmet burgers and steak fries have been in my repertoire of culinary expeditions. Why, just up the street there used to be a franchise, though it suffered from an affliction which could not be observed, but for the symptoms, and the empty Saturday nights eventually devoured it whole, leaving only an empty shell with a sign that reads "For Lease". Now, Red Robins are a trek for me. They are not far, for in truth I have gone further for less; but it is still a strain upon my soul to venture through its doors into the din of an establishment forever ensnared in a state of limbo. For you see, when I was a child I could gaze on the decor and fare with an innocence, ignorant to the truth behind each flagrant splash of Americana. And the truth of Red Robin is not that it is in need of help, but that it must have attributed its success through the sale of its soul. Red Robin is soul less, and it reeks of a corporate world that believes putting on a mask is enough to convince us. Red Robin burgers are a foul deception from the devil himself. Each one a savory journey through distinct and well-made flavor; but each time, day after day, on one end of town or another, they taste the same. The burgers touted as gourmet may live up to that title in the eyes of some, but to me they are the Stepford wives of restaurant burgers: exactly what you wanted, but systematized to the point where there is not an ounce of human inspiration in it, and it might as well be made by an assembly line of machines. And every time I take a bite and enjoy it, a part of me is eaten alive. The steak fries also tell the tale of this Faustian kitchen, bottomless like the depths of emptiness found all around you as you sit and are engulfed in noise that drowns out any atmosphere. All the free fries in the world cannot and will not make up for their real price, the price we all pay when we agree to partake in the fruit. But the real tragedy in all of this is the people. Whenever I walk in and feel the chill rush through me, my bones aching with regret, I am afraid for the poor lost soul who will be my boatman on this proverbial River Styx, for their fate must be worse than mine. It varies from meeting to meeting: some come with their own packaged, bright-eyed cheer, which is either a facade to smother the torment inside, a willful ignorance, or a brave and concerted effort to bring light into their dismal existence; others have reached the acceptance stage of their journey, and their feet carry them as slowly as their minds, crawling along at a pace of a human weighed down by the solemnity of a broken reality. Our latest endeavor brought us to Tyler, his name only known to us due to our own skills of observation, spying his nametag worn like a badge of shame halfway down his shirt. We were greeted and served with diligence in what I can only describe as being acceptably efficient, though it was a forced and placid efficiency. He would not provide us with his name, nor acknowledge he was capable of any human emotion; his mind, it would seem, was a slate, onto which Red Robin had carved their own personality, devoid as it was of all compassion. Our server bore an uncanny resemblance of a fellow human being, but all besides the basic features and a commendable, yet futile desire to push forward in his work seemed to separate him from the robin itself, which stared straight past our eyes in an unsettling, harlequin grin. That is how it was, and how it will always be; as we sit and wait, ticking our lives away in the hopes of some humanity with our meals, we will be met with nothing but disappointment.  And the bottomless steak fries only delay the problem of filling the ever-present void that comes from entering this sour tomb where all that is good and pure sleeps restlessly. Are we but the machines? Fueling ourselves for another day of grinding down our minds and sharpening our claws for the next meal?  What do we deserve and what are we given, and where does the disconnect lie? Is it with expectation? Or do we have an inalienable right to soul? Maybe it would be different if all pretenses were dropped, if Red Robin could admit that what they do they do well: assemble food to be purchased and consumed, but nothing more. We have no right to deny them the right to try and do more, but their efforts are hollow and my time grows short. Maybe one night it will resonate that I am trapped in the snare of a monster parading as a man. One day we will all succumb, and heaven help us when we do.

The burgers are good. The order to go is fast. But the fries the don't give you is ridiculous. For paying for endless fries while getting a to go order you think they be generous. But I can seriously count my fries. 7 fries and that's it. Stop being cheap!!!!

We came here for dinner with friends. It started out bad we had to wait over 30 mins. The girl at the counter took our friends name down wrong. Once the manager was notified she got us a table and we were seated ready to eat. I was surprised that the service was so good as they were extremely busy! This is my second time here and I really like it!

Only because Yelp won't allow anything less than 1 star. First and last time here. We waited 10 minutes just to be seated for half an hour without a server. Flashed our light in the kiosk twice and no one ever showed up. Manager was making her rounds and never stopped at our table. Hostess got us drinks but never came back with my 2 yr old daughters apple juice. She cried as we were leaving because she loves Red Robin and was really looking forward to pizza and apples.

Service was horrible! We waited at the hostess stand - there was an employee who was handling phone orders and didn't even acknowledge us. Then my daughters burger arrived with no cheese as ordered - it took 10 min to come back to our table and she says that "In-N-Out tastes better". The hostess had to refill my sons drink. Service was horrible! We definitely won't be dining here again.

The bad: The poor acoustics that produce a deafening cacophony I don't mind this particular franchise so much except for the noise levels.  They have a dish called Ensenada Chicken that's relatively healthy and tasty.  Obviously I was in no frame of mind on this occasion to think of my body as a temple.  In any event, as far as the chain wars go, it doesn't completely suck if they could do something about the background noise.

Visited this Red Robin for a quick lunch, and we had Francis as our server. She was really great and provided excellent customer service, got our food out fast, and brought us refills without asking. One of the best servers I've ever had, and she was very friendly and nice. Definitely will be coming back!
Awful service no silverware, food was Mediocre service was slow. I had to ask for napkins then ask for silverware again. Not the best time

Red Robin food is usually pretty good. Tara, our server was pretty good. My wife is Gluten free. Macaroni was in her salad. Avocado in an avocado bacon burger is as hard to find as an honest crook. We asked for the manager, I can't give you the real managers name. He was in hiding. The mater Dee (sp)was sent instead.  Wow now my wife tells me there's no toilet paper in the ladies rest room. If you own stock, sell it! Fast. Tomorrow I may call corporate.

Standard chain. Guacamole Bacon Burger.  For those that love guac and bacon and burgers, do I really need to explain anymore? Service was meh.  Pretty absent for most of the meal.  Had to ask for refills.  I see u glance at the table, empty fries? maybe I'd like some more? I've discovered how restaurants encourage drink sales.  Serve atrocious water.  Tap water here had a super strong off-taste.  Not mineral taste.  Like sewage taste.  Lemons were to no avail.  Hot water was safe for some reason.  Boosting dat drink sale.

Just ate here with my family.... DO NOT EAT HERE! We walked up to our table there was food still in the center of the table from the previous customers and water rings left over from the glasses. I literally had to use sanitizer to clean our own table! Then our waiter took approx 10min to come to our table. My son ordered a kids hamburger and there was melted cheese on his plate!!!! He had a hamburger NOT a cheese burger!!! My veggie burger was under cooked....NEVER AGAIN GROSS!
The BLTA croissant was pretty stingy on the turkey. There was only 2 very thin slices, and the first set of fries were cold.
The Royal Burger is the best taysting Burger.  Our server was great, except I didn't like being rushed and I didn't get a thank you when we left.

Its really sad that this location has gone so far down hill.  Its been a few months since we been to the Cypress location and it appears that they have done a complete makeover, staff included. From the appearance, its modernized.  From the staff experience, a total step backwards.  We had to wait just to be greeted at the door.  Well, if you count the 3 different people saying that someone will be with you in a moment a greeting, then I guess I stand corrected.  Food was not delivered correctly to our table, nor was it timely. Bathrooms were messy and smelled like urine. It wasn't the normal RR experience that I had become used to.  I don't think I will be back, and judging by the Yelp reviews, I'm not the only one.  If you are craving RR, I would keep driving to the next one. I recommend the District in Tustin. Better staff, which make it worth the drive.

Ok, I don't get this petite burger thingy that they are doing here now.......isn't it the same patty they are servin up at Micky D's but  $4 bucks more in cost! I will stick with the regular big mammoth burgers that they usually serve....even if I can only eat about half!  At least I feel like I am getting my moneys worth.

You have to order the garlic fries (Addicting)! and endless! Don't be surprised the first batch only has about 6 or 7 steak fries so order more right away. This Red Robbin location has Horrible service, if I could leave no stars I would. Ordered bar wings to start and 35 minutes later came out boneless wings not what we ordered. When our waitress came around we let her know we were given the wrong ones she took them and didn't even apologize. 15 minutes later the waitress comes back and says the wings will be out shortly. Asked if it will it be ok if we bring out your food first. At that point I told her to cancel the wings, the food came out seconds after, and everything was cold. Once again brought it to her attention  and didn't apologize, her response was oh really, I said yes thought I'd bring it up to your attention waiting about an hour for the food and it comes out cold. Bottom line, horrible service. Worst experience ever. Won't be coming back.

Just finished getting dinner here with my husband tonight and I was much more impressed by their service tonight than the past several times we've eaten here. Our server was Riley, and he was friendly and attentive.

So let's start with why it's two stars and not one. The ONLY reason why is because we like Red Robin and we will eat there again(just a different location).  My mom was visiting from out of state and my birthday is this month so we figured we would get my free birthday burger. We arrived at around 5:30 on a Friday. We have a two year old and did not want to wait too long to be seated. Having several years of restaurant experience, I chose to arrive before the "main" dinner rush. We were promptly greeted and seated, but there were 5 waitresses hanging out at the hostess stand along with two hostesses. One of the waitresses complained about how slow it was and how she didn't understand why there were so many of them working. I spotted three managers, two of whom were running food and taking payments. The dining area was filled to about 70% of capacity, and I counted no less than 8 servers (plus two managers assisting) yet we had 5 different people come to our table. Our waitress took our order but we did not see her again until the very end. Different sever brought drinks, a third brought our food, a fourth refilled our drinks, and we had to ask the manager for our check when we were ready to leave. The burger ordered with a gluten free bun arrived on a regular bum and had to be sent back, the egg on the Royal Red burger was ordered over medium(which consists of a completely set egg white and partially set yolk) was underdone with the egg running everywhere. We had to ask for refills on drinks, ask to have the sauces brought out (which we had requested when we placed our food order), and we had to ask for the side of broccoli that was ordered to be brought out as it was forgotten. When we brought the general lack of care and haphazard delivery of service to one of the managers he could barely muster an apology and said something along the lines of "well you did get a free birthday burger" as if taking advantage of one of their promotions means we should expect to receive subpar service. Everyone has an off night, but a little empathy and a real apology would have added at least another star. I guess they're used to below average performance at this location. We'll still go to Red Robin, just another store.

Lunch crowd is tough.. They are under staffed all the time.. After a third visit of piss poor service , (not waitress or waiters fault) slow food return, cold food that was obviously not thawed appropriately and a manger that was condensing and about as helpful as hemorrhoid has lead me to not return to this particular Red Robin.
Just recieved my free birthday burger.  It was extremely delicious and was FREE. Over all I have always enjoyed Red Robin...their bottomless fries and burgers. Sign up to get yours!

Horrible. Where is the management?!?! My family visited this location on 9/28/15 for lunch, and the service was horrible. Hostess was unfriendly. We waited about 15 minutes to be seated. When we were seated the hostess saw that our ipad (apparently they utilize this instead of paying actual people to help with the service) was broken. She mummbled something under her breath and walked away. Waited about another 45 minutes for the waitress to acknowledge us at our table.  Waitress was over-worked, but still could have been more helpful and pleasant. Not our fault that your store has bad management.   So, we waited 15 minutes to be seated, 45 minutes to order, waited another 45 minutes for our food to arrive. When our food did arrived they did not bring my father's food until 15 minutes AFTER we received ours. Waitress only said that they didn't understand the order. It was Fish and Chips.  Normally when dining out you will see a manager walking around asking groups how their service was. Can you guess if one was at this location? Nope. Horrible, horrible, horrible. Won't be back.

Didn't even eat here because after 45 minutes they couldn't seat our party. We were told when we arrived we could expect a 15 minute wait.  25 minutes later we were told the "smaller parties" in front of us would be seated first since there was "no way" to accommodate our two high chairs at those tables. I told Tara the hostess that the children could both sit in regular chairs then and she said that "wouldn't make a difference." From a practical aspect - then we were a party of 5 and a party of 4 wanting to sit at adjacent tables. And if the only reason they couldn't accommodate us was the highchairs how could that not make a difference?  After 35 minutes and 5 families of 4 or more later ... We asked the other much less rude hostess how much longer we could anticipate waiting. She stated they were waiting for a party to finish, apologized, and stated we would be seated any minute. We were just about to wait until Tara then immediately seated a party of 7 (we were 9 - remember with 2 being either high chairs or regular chairs which could be added to the end of tables). I explained to Tara that they had seated so many parties in front of us that they didn't need to "wait for a table to open up" we could have sat at one of them and that it wasn't okay to seat immediately a party of 7 when we had been waiting over 45 minutes and after 8 families, she actually RAISED her voice at me and snapped, "well they had less people then you" We left because I was shocked by her rudeness and my son asked me "Why did she have to be so mean?" Since 7 families all of at least 4 people were seated prior to us - it was clear they were isolating one specific table and waiting for that party to leave. When multiple spaces with two tables along side one another (which would have been fine) were turned over as we waited.  So when they could have easily accommodated us had they not put those guests ahead of us ... Tara didn't understand how to prioritize seating. I hope they offer their hostesses retraining, we've just moved to the area and would have enjoyed this as a place to have a family dinner but will not being returning.

total hit or miss at this location. Be ready to be ignored by hosts, servers and managers.  Sometimes the food comes out as a group; sometimes I'm done before anyone else gets their food. Come if you're feeling lucky. Otherwise, opt for somewhere else.

Ordered boneless wings. Arrived cold like the corpses on Walking Dead. Sent back to receive 5 warm boneless wings the size of McDonald's nuggets we're paying $5 for. Requested a side of garlic aioli with my bacon burger. It came out as white as the napkins with a flavor no more than simple mayo. The bacon was undercooked like Carl's Jr and rubbery as well as thin. The only reason why this review didn't get one star is that the burger was warm (not hot) and the bottomless fries were hot and fresh. It's a shame the excellent wait staff has to put up with terrible products and horrible cook staff. What once was a place to look forward to is not a place I fear for what they will inevitably let me down for. Again.

Our server Christina was rude. Asked for more fries and she said "I suppose". We were there a bit before closing and she loudly said said "ha what a tip, I hope they don't come back" we would have tipped more of she was actually polite about doing her job.  definitely won't be coming back to this Red Robin. 2/6/16
Great food. Plus beer equals funtimes. Had the red tavern double with sweet potatoe fries. Both were delicious. GO ANGELS! ANGELS 14  mets 2

I placed a to go order last night.  I got home and got halfway through my meal to find a long hair in my food.  I was disgusted and threw it away.  I will never visit here again.  Maybe they need to invest in hair nets and have the men cover their beards while they are cooking like Costco does.

This is my go to red robin, and it never fails to disappoint. Never had a bad experience. I went in a few days ago though, and was greeted by the rudest host ever. His name was Jordan, I know this because I went to high school with him. He just acted as though he didn't even care about his job! It was annoying especially since I used to be a host, I know how to treat customers that come into a restaurant. This won't affect me from going to this red robin, but I just wish that they could hire people that seem to enjoy their job, like all the other employees I have interacted with.

Horrible service, this was not my first time here with a bad experience but it is my last. We waited over 15 minutes just to have our drink order placed about 40 minutes to get our food. Our waiter had the nerve to complain to us about how she had asked if we needed anything .... Yes, she did ask but we never got what we asked for. We had to flag a different girl down and ask again after about another 15 minutes. We asked to speak to a manager because we then also received the wrong check, they didn't even see apologetic about all the time we waited and all the mistakes instead the girl Josie proceeded to be defensive and run her mouth when al we wanted was to pay and get out of there. They need some type of customer service training. I didn't even want to give one star but I had to choose at least one

Kids Mac n cheese came with broccoli in it (accidentally) and they did replace it with a clean one.  It wasn't crowded, so I'm not sure why it'd be that bad. Won't be back. EDITED TO ADD-received an email and an apology plus an electronic gift amount to use at another visit.
