We wait about 5 minutes for our server to check back up on us and tell her there's an insect floating in my beloved coors light.  She looks at us like we're retarded and says "ooookaaaay." F*ck you bitch. About 5 minutes later, the manager comes out and gives me a new beer and tells me, "It wasn't a worm in your beer, haha, it was a stem from a strawberry that was floating around."  I think to myself, hhmmm I didn't know that stems from strawberrys are segmented, have antenna and legs. No apology from him, he just laughs. Get bent A-hole. A little more on the slow/horrible service.... Friend: Can I get some hot sauce? Server: Okay (10 minutes later) Server: Is everything okay guys? Need anything else? Friend: Uuummmm, I asked for some hot sauce a while ago? Server: Oh yeah, I forgot. I think she was irie.   Only decent thing here was the bottomless fries.  I'd rather eat some shit that Andrew Zimmern gets down on than ever eat at this place again.

There's nothing special at Red Robins, just classic burger. For fries, you have choice of either regular fries or garlic fries, they're both good. Had the Burnin' Love Burger, if was good, but nothing too special. Thought the food was a bit overpriced.
Very good food! Very nice people! Best restaurants in Cypress area!

Really only sit at the bar, but I have been really enjoying this location for quite some time now.  Usually have great food and service.  The drinks have almost always been amazing.  Only negative, recently they changed the way they wrap and present the food.  They used to wrap it in paper and put it in a basket, but now its on a plate with fries in this weird metal ring with them in center.  The fries arent as good now.  They are mushy from the heat from the ring.  Probably sitting in front of the heater before delivery.  Other than this bad change to their presentation, I think they are great!

I like this place. The food is good but sometimes the service is lacking. However we do have a big family (7 kids) and we can sometimes overwhlem a server. That being said, we go about once a month and most often have an enjoyable time. The kids always get shirley temples and love them, while I love the bottomless fries. We were there last night when they announced the news about Osama.

Visited to get my free burger for my birthday. The food was just like any other Red Robin. Personally I think Islands has better burgers but it was free. My server was very cordial even though I didn't have to pay for anything. He was quick with my drink and food, he also checked up on me several times. The restaurant is clean and the atmosphere is comfortable for dining in.
Good food and good service. Alejandro was a great server, on point with checking in while not being too overwhelming. The food was good with a good price point, no complaints on my end at all.

They got my order wrong. When I got my fries there was hair in them. They refilled my coke with diet coke. My glass was waiting to be filled for 5 minutes. It took flagging the manager down to get the drink fixed. He offered no compensation. Not even an apology. With all the negatives I have to say the food was really good. I just wish the experience was better.

This place was awful, I know Red Robin is not a 5 star restaurant but for a quick burger I was very disappointed. My mother and I went there yesterday for a quick lunch place while we were out doing our errands (Costco, Target, and a Carwash).  We ordered appetizers that went well, but when our burgers came it all went down hill. I asked for ranch and buffalo sauce for my fries, it never came and I look around to see where the food runner was to see if my ranch was coming, instead I see him standing by the kitchen laughing. I then watch him bring food to another table and a minute later bring them there condiments. As I was waiting for my ranch to come I look into my basket of food to see a hair in my fries, I told our server and she brought me a new basket and new fries. A manager visited my table and apologizes and says if I order desert it will be on him, I didn't want desert, I no longer wanted my current food why would I order more. So moving on my mother ordered a boca burger with pepper jack cheese when it was served to her no cheese. When it finally did get served to her with the cheese it was just a poorly tasting boca burger. When I tried to eat my burger it was covered in the "Red Robin seasoning" it was like eating a salt lick I couldnt even taste the cheese or the bacon.  The manager did come by and take it off of my bill but it was over all a very awful experience, I left there feeling very disapointed.

Food is red robin's food, so what do you expect?  But there is one big difference between this one and all the other ones: the service.  They had amazing service at this restaurant.   From the fries coming to the drink refills to the food coming fast, it was amazing!  Again, this was with a group of well over 25 for my dragonboat team and they served everyone well.  I rarely had to ask for anything.  Actually, I don't think I did.  They would offer before I even had to.  For a red robin's I think this is the best it gets.

Went there to grab a quick bite. Which turned out to be a bad idea. Ordered a burger, with cheese, they forgot the cheese, found a hair in the fries - I Know Yuck!, forgot to bring condiments, oh and over salted the food so it was not eatable.
Great food and service and it was for our office outing for a birthday lunch. Had 15 employees and food still came quickly and was really good. Chicken Pesto sandwich is to die for

I love Red Robin, but everytime I go to this location, they do something to aggravate us. This time, we walk in, the bar section is pretty much empty and the host tells us it's going to be 15-20 minutes. I look over at the bar and say "it's empty, can we just grab a booth?" and he says, "no, that's a 20 minute wait." So we stand there and I notice that there's a business party on the patio and all the waiters are running around and they clearly can't handle it. So we wait, while the manger walks back and forth checking some note pad and not doing much of anything. The food was ok, the caesar salad was weak, but the fries were good. The server was nice, but you could tell she was totally stressed out. I was waiting for the manager to stop and ask us how they did, but I think he knew it wasn't going to be a glowing review. Seriously, it's burgers, not a big deal, but if you can't handle a restaurant at 70% capapcity during dinner hour, you're done. Next time it'll be Katella Deli.

It looks like a caricature of everything obnoxious about chain american restaurants.  The walls are covered in kitchy images, the waters wear flair, there's loud video games at the entry way, and every 20 minutes the waiters are singing a happy birthday song.  any of these characteristics can be done well, but the execution of the RR forces a sensory overload. The food was mediocre at best and the menu photos were misleading.  the prices were also high for what you receive.  the bottomless fries are a great draw but if they're not great fries, why bother ordering more.  i gave it a try, and i'm done.
The food is consistent.  The service is usually pretty good.  Great place to take kids.  Don't forget to ask for your balloon!!!

Avoid at all costs.  My Blue Cheese Burger was so salty that it was almost inedible.  The noise level in the restaurant for a week day lunch left my partner and I silent since we couldn't hear one another talk.  The waiter was disinterested to say the least.

Went to dinner for my son's birthday.  No waiting for a table, service was wonderful and we had a very good and friendly waitress.  The food came fast; no mistakes and we never had to ask for a soda or coffee refill.  Even the manager stopped by to see how everything was.  My daughter loves the ribs and mac plate.  I love their avocado-cobb salad.  I would recommend this Red Robin and would definitely return.

This restaurant is hit or miss in my book.  The riblets...ehhhh  I've had better.  Some of the burgers and the Cobb salads are  very good.  Sweet Potatoes frys with sweet and sour ketchup are Delicious.  Good drinks and malts too.  Service is hit or miss also.  So over-all score is  a thr

I'm a man of habit.  I pretty much get the same thing at the same places most of the time, so if something isn't up to par at one of the chains, DOWN GOES YOUR RATING!  Haha but here are this Red Robin, it was pretty much what I expected. - Whiskey River BBQ Burger was as good as I expected it to be.  The fries were piping hot every time we got a new basket - There were many televisions to keep me updated on the sporting events I was following, although depending on where you are sitting, you might be too far.  But you cant really be picky.  When you walk in, theres a freakin television in the floor. Yeah that's just two things.  I don't really expect much from a Red Robin.  I get my food, unlimited fries, and get up outta there.

Summary:  Kid friendly with your typical "Burger Joint" fare, Red Robin is a good sit down alternative to fast food.  Plus they have "all you can eat" french fries, so that's a plus. I seem to wind up at Red Robin a lot.  My wife likes their salads and my daughter likes their french fries. Red Robin has your typical offerings:  lots of burgers with a variety of topping, plenty of salads covered in cheese and dressing, and a wide assortment of other deep fried goodies.  The burgers are excellent and they even make a mean veggie pattie. The bar selection is better than you would expect from this type of place. Great beer selection on tap (they even carry the seasonal Sam Adams). The mixed drinks are pretty good too (try the Nuclear Iced Tea).   The service is fast and friendly.  All in all a good value.

I truly love this place.  My favorite bit of badness is a petit cheeseburger (I love the tomato relish) with unlimited fries.  Their salads are pretty good, but I always come back to the burgers because they are so tasty. Service is good, and there always someone coming by to refill drinks or just to check on you.  I don't go here a ton, but on occasion it really hits the spot.

This is for sure my favorite Red Robin.  It's in kind of an industrial part of town, so you don't get swamped with screaming kids, or tourists.  The staff is always ready to help, and they actually listen.  I guess I'm a picky eater, because most places mess at least one thing up.  But not this place.  They're 10/10.  Only reason I can't give them 5 stars is the noise.  I can get pretty loud in there when the place is full.

We arrived on a Sunday afternoon around 3. It was not busy at all and no one else waiting, then we waited about 10 minutes for a table for 5. A group of four walked in and were sat right away. Finally got our table and waited another 25 minutes for our drinks. We basically had to ask who our server was because no one had helped us. Then the drink order came in wrong. Blah. We ordered, food was amazing. We got our food right away once I told a manager what was going on.  Again, food was amazing. I had a blue ribbon burger and my husband had a smokenpepper. Kids had mac and cheese and pizzas. The manager compensated us 25% off and a free desert. We won't be running back because of the slow service. The manager really tried to compensate as much as he could and kept asking us if we were ok last half of experience.  Let's just say this is not the first time this place has had sloooooooooow service. I don't know if the servers have too many stations?  But something is going downhill.

I had a takeout order during my lunch break. The wait staff was actually very nice, friendly and helpful. I ordered a turkey burger well done, dry bun no butter, and chipotle on side. I repeated each time the person said back my order. Took a little longer than expected but that was fine. When I got the burger, the staff read back my order and I said oh the chipotle on the side...and she said, oh let me ask the kitchen...uh oh, figured that meant it was on. Yup, doused with sauce and of course bun with butter even though I said no to that. And the burger was this weird compressed nasty meat. Why?! So weird! Oh well, as I said the staff was nice so maybe give them try with another item. Good luck!
Nothing special here. Classic hamburger place with low quality meat. Fun atmosphere though On a Friday and the servers are always friendly. The wraps are actually pretty tasty though.

When you just want to gorge on a burger and bottomless fries then Red Robin is the place to go.  It's a good place if you feel like showing up in shorts and flip flops and just looking to get out for a quick bite and a drink.  The burgers and fries always deliver.  They have a decent selection of draft beer (Blue Moon, Fat Tire, Newcastle) and a full bar including creative mixed drink options.  They also have the best strawberry lemonade -- it's a must try. I usually start off just asking for a basket of fries (gotta take advantage of the bottomless fries).  They have really good steak fries always cooked perfectly lightly golden.  Add a little of their signature seasoning salt to the fries is always the way to go.  If I'm really looking to splurge, their onion rings are also really good.  I've never been disappointed with their onion rings. As far as the burgers -- my personal favorites are the chili burger, the guacamole bacon burger and the turkey burger. The chili burger is served open faced and loaded with chili.  It's a knife and fork type of deal.  The guacamole bacon burger always hits the spot with the perfect combination of guac and bacon.  Then there's the turkey burger which is always perfectly seasoned.  I think the only other place that has a better turkey burger (ironically enough) is Cheesecake Factory. The service is generally ok, not great but good enough.  But hey, you get what you pay for, this is not a high end restaurant.  Very casual. End result -- I enjoy Red Robin for what they offer, they have good burgers and fries and it's a good option when you're looking to get out of the house for an inexpensive yet satisfying dining experience.  I will be back.

What can I say, it's Red Robin. Nothing really sticks out about it and not really too much to hate on. The food is moderately priced and the mixed drinks are pretty good. I think the only real appeal to bring people in is the endless fries. Nothing really sticks out and wows me but I've never had bad service which is why I gave it a three star.

I've been to this location a few times and each time it was just alright service and well, burgers are burgers.  This last time my grandmother and I went to Red Robin and we came in right after a large group of basketball players, probably 15 of them. The hostess seated them first of course and for some reason NEVER CAME BACK!  My grandmother and I waited a total of 15 minutes and the place wasn't even packed. Finally we flagged down a manager who was very nice and courteous and seated us at a table. He said he would bring water while we waited for our server. Water was brought over to us lickity split and the server had not come over to us yet. We both decided that we knew what we wanted and it had already been 15 minutes and NO SERVER! We're both starving at this point and every server that walks by us doesn't even bother asking if we've been helped and finally I'm able to get the attention of a server and tell him we've been waiting for what seems like forever. He said he'd be back with our server... NEVER CAME BACK! We tried finding the manager that helped us and no luck. The hostess wasn't very helpful either so we just decided to leave.  Worst service EVER! I've never had this hard of a time before at this place especially at 1:30 pm! If I ever do come back to this place it will be because it's for someone's birthday. Pretty disappointing.

Great place to stop off after 24hr fitness down the street. Bomb food cold drinks the only issue is the bar is very small and everyone can ease drop on your conversations other than that super friendly especially the bartender lyndsey.

Bottomless fries?!! Who wouldn't come here?! yes, burger prices are steep but they are actually pretty good and if you are a huge fries fan then keep them coming and hopefully you can get your money's worth.  I've tried the sliders, american red robin burger, mushroom burger -- all good. Fries are the steak fries, u can get garlic fries or regular depending on what hamburger you order. One time the waitress allowed me to switch between the two even though my order only came with regular fries.  Second and most important thing, strawberry lemonade is THE BEST!!! It is also bottomless. I think max I've had were 3 refills, my friend had 5!!  I think the waiters are used to it so no worries, mind as well tell them to bring double instead of having them come back everytime for a refill.  I like this place!!

My husband, two teenage girls and I are probably in here about 4 times minimum a month and  have only once been disappointed in the food.  When I brought it up to the manager (Bernice), she graciously removed the cost of meal from our bill and gave us certificates for appetizers and desserts. Bernice is always hard working and has a super positive attitude about dealing with most everyone she everyone she interacts with.  The waiters there are pretty efficient and really do not make us wait too long.  I invite anyone who gripes about customer service to try working for customers just to see how frustrating it can be.  One finds that not everyone can be made happy and are just doomed to be miserable and are rarely satisfied.

Food is below average for a Red Robin, there are better ones. At our last visit, we sat very close to the kitchen area. I suspect their shift just started. The manager did this "rah-rah" thing for the employees where he/she gathered them all together. Fine. The problem was is that he distracted our waitress who forgot most of our order. I point it out to the waitress when the meal came and suddenly the manager is apologizing for the waitress. They tried to make it right, but frankly, too little too late. Your mileage may vary. This was in 2011.

I walked over here to grab lunch while I had new tires mounted at the Costco Tire Center.  Since I was alone I decided to sit at the bar. I was also hoping to watch some TV while I waited.  They had the smallest TVs I've ever see in a bar.  I mean ever! They must have been little 13in TVs.  At least the one behind the bar was. They actually have very good burgers here.  I prefer the A1 peppercorn burger, it has a bit of a kick to it.  They also have endless fries.  The prices seem in line with their competition.  The times I've been in here, the service has been consistently good. The bartender (I believe her name was Lizzette) in particular was very efficient and checked on me several times to see if there was anything I needed. The ambiance is where this place loses points. It just seems a little too bright and noisy, and the TVs were a joke.  All  in all it was a pretty good lunch experience, and I'd return again.
The burgers are very good and you have to love bottom-less fries.  The scenery is cheesy, but the staff is friendly.

slow service on a slow day unacceptable! ordered the same thing. tasted worse. burger was overcooked, too much sauce, made the buns soggy and nasty before i even ate it. stingy with bottomless fries. when i got it, the fries burnt.  sticky tables, bad service, never again. if you want red robins, go to the one in los cerritos mall.

I love this place, especially on my birthday! If you're signed up for the mailing list, you get a free meal on your birthday!  Santa Fe burger is ok, whiskey burger is better, but the turkey burger is even more better!  I love coming here for the endless fries....I always ask for a tray of fries when we get there.  You've got to eat it with the honey mustard...mMmmmm

I went here last night instead of going to a bar. I wanted to drink and also to eat some food. The burger and fries was like $10 which was a lot for my wallet but the service was pretty good and my drink was cheaper than i thought. I just got my Tokyo tea for 5 bucks and my friend got her Bay Breeze for like 4 bucks. The drink was actually stronger than i thought because i wasn't sure if the bartender really knew how to make a Tokyo tea. Haha. O well. Stronger drink for me. :) It was around 10 because i got out of work later so it was a decent place to go after work. It wasn't crowded so that was good.  What i thought was sort of annoying were these group of ladies that were drunk, really loud, and annoying that we were seated next to. I wanted to sit somewhere else... The good things were the service, burgers were decent, wasn't busy around 10 (an hour before they closed), and i got to watch the Boston/Rays playoff game. I forgot to mention they has pretty much all my favorite beers on tap...New castle, Fat Tire, Blue Moon, Hefenwiser...Woohoo! The bad: pricey burgers....um..drunk noisy people...

My friend and I went here later in the night and it wasn't crowded at all so the customer service was nice. I got the freckled lemonade which was awesome and it even had chunks of strawberries in it which made it even better. Both my friend and I got the Bonzai Burger which had tomatoes, lettuce, mayo, burger, Chedder cheese, pineapple and teriyaki sauce. The burger I had was good but there was a lot of teriyaki sauce so it was messy. On the other hand, my friend got a Boca burger and only her first bite was good, the rest ended up being a regular Boca burger. That is not exactly what you want when you pay like ten bucks for it. The prices are steep but the fries are endless which helps it out a little even though you are full by the time you even want more fries.

how i love this place! this location especially was very accommodating to our needs, since we were a large bunch. it was a Saturday night, we had just left the beach and were looking for a place to serve us all. we had a party of 19.  i used my handy dandy phone with Internet access, googled this location, and called ahead to make a reservation. the hostess said she couldnt take any reservations, as it was based on a first come first served seating.  i explained the situation - we were 19 ravenous people, anxious to eat gourmet burgers and steak fries. she asked her manager, who then asked me what time we would be arriving.  I replied 10 mins, and they said theyll reserve a table for us. woo hoo!  we walked in and to our relief they kept their word. There was a table (the surfboard table the call it) waiting for us, all set up.  We were served right away and the waiter was very attentive.   so the food, of course its good there. my only complaint, and i regret to say this, is that when they served the fries and burger baskets, the fries were..minimal, so it seemed inevitable that their "bottomless fries" policy would be put to use, thus making the waiter work extra hard, which seems more tedious than it ought to have been, which doesnt make sense....i digress....anyways i am a strawberry freckled lemonade, mushroom & swiss burger and garlic fries loyalist.  i thank GOD i wasnt on a date, cuz heaven help me i cannot resist ordering garlic steak fries.  those fries will leave your breath something fierce.  i swear like two days went by and i sill felt garlic-y.  and YES i brushed my teeth and cleaned my tongue profusely.   only with the love and support of family and friends can i order my garlic fries with confidence.
